description: The underlying cause of the issue described in the post is the mismanagement of the recovery environment files on Server 2022 systems. Specifically, when disabling the recovery environment, the requisite files are copied back to their default location (C:\Windows\System32\Recovery) without freeing up space in the recovery partition. This enables patching and overwriting of the files without necessarily resizing the recovery partition. The recommended approach by Microsoft involves resizing the recovery partition to accommodate future updates, which the author implies is not favored in this workaround. The particular approach leverages PowerShell commands to manage the recovery environment effectively. This allows the installation of update KB5034439 and KB5034441 without the complications of modifying partition sizes.
